title: 113_hr3037
content: The "Government Litigation Savings Act" is the short title of the Act. It modifies the Equal Access to Justice provisions. The "Government Litigation Savings Act" amends Section 504 of title 5, United States Code, regarding fees and expenses in agency proceedings. Fees can only be awarded to a prevailing party with a direct interest in the adjudication. The "Government Litigation Savings Act" amends Section 504 of title 5, United States Code, regarding fees and expenses in agency proceedings. It requires the agency conducting the adversary adjudication to make parties aware of the provisions of the section. Additionally, it mandates the reduction of fees that are unduly or unreasonably high. The "Government Litigation Savings Act" amends Section 504 of title 5, United States Code, regarding fees and expenses in agency proceedings. It requires agencies to inform parties of the section's provisions and mandates reducing fees that are unduly high. The amendment increases the hourly rate to $200 and includes the net worth of parent entities or subsidiaries in determining a party's net worth. The amendment to the "Government Litigation Savings Act" includes defining a subsidiary as an entity controlled by a party. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget will adjust the maximum hourly fee annually based on the Consumer Price Index. Additionally, court cases under Section 2412(d) of title 28, United States Code, will see changes in fee regulations. The amendment to the "Government Litigation Savings Act" includes provisions for awarding fees and expenses to prevailing parties in civil actions against the United States, unless the court finds the government's position justified or special circumstances exist. Fees can only be awarded to parties with a direct interest in the case. The amendment to the "Government Litigation Savings Act" allows for awarding fees and expenses to prevailing parties in civil actions against the United States. Fees can only be awarded to parties with a direct interest in the case, including medical costs, property damage, determination of benefits, and other expenses. The court shall determine the fees unduly or unreasonably incurred. The amendment to the "Government Litigation Savings Act" allows for awarding fees and expenses to prevailing parties in civil actions against the United States. The net worth of a party shall include the net worth of any parent entity or subsidiary. The amendment allows for adjusting maximum hourly fees based on changes in the Consumer Price Index. Clerical amendments are made to Section 2412 of title 28, United States Code. The Act and its amendments will take effect on the enactment date. Certain amendments will apply to awards of fees and expenses under specific sections after the enactment date.
